info.title: Generate Batch REST API
info.description: For more details and full context regarding Quadient REST API services, consult documentation at: https://www.quadient.com/documentation.

post.description: Returns the current status of the specified batch job with its details.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Job management. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description: Returns the current statuses of the specified batch jobs with their details.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Job management. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description: Deletes the specified batch job.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Job management. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description:
Deletes batch jobs in bulk, i.e. all jobs in the specified time range. Only one action (per company) can be performed at a time. 
 Note that no jobs that are started after the request is called will be deleted regardless of the set time range.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Maintenance. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description: Resubmits the selected batch job for processing, i.e. the job will be run from start to finish regardless of the previously processed items within the batch (e.g. all emails will be sent again).

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Batch processing. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description: Starts a batch job using a defined processing pipeline.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Batch processing. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

json.description: File containing JSON parameters in a format identical to the application/json version of the request. The maximum size of this file is 100 kB.

dataFile1...dataFileX.description:
Individual data files containing input data. By default, the files are saved to an input folder in the job working folder.

The Content-Disposition header must contain the filename parameter as this is the value used to reference the files (the value of the name parameter is not used in further processing).
To reference a data file, use the request:// connector in the following format: request://\<filename>, e.g. request://Customers.json.
Note that using request:// without specifying the file name references the first uploaded data file (i.e. this is useful when uploading only one file).

You can attach maximally 100 data files. The maximum size of each file is 50 MB and the maximum size of all data files is 100 MB.

For each data file, you can define a custom folder header to specify the working folder directory to which it will be uploaded. If undefined, the files are uploaded to the default folder.

post.description: Starts a batch job using an ad hoc processing pipeline. This allows you to specify your settings in the request itself.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Batch processing. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

errorRecovery.configuration: icm://Sample Solutions/Warning Configuration/Configuration with horizontal overflow recovery.wpr

value.pipelineName: Print PDF attachments and send emails
Print PDF attachments and send emails
Print PDF email attachments from CA template
Print PDF email attachments from CA template
Data validation to Inspire Native to PDF

json.description: File containing JSON parameters in a format identical to the application/json version of the request. The maximum size of this file is 100 kB.

dataFile1...dataFileX.description:
Individual data files containing input data. By default, the files are saved to an input folder in the job working folder.

The Content-Disposition header must contain the filename parameter as this is the value used to reference the files (the value of the name parameter is not used in further processing).
To reference a data file, use the request:// connector in the following format: request://\<filename>, e.g. request://Customers.json.
Note that using request:// without specifying the file name references the first uploaded data file (i.e. this is useful when uploading only one file).

You can attach maximally 100 data files. The maximum size of each file is 50 MB and the maximum size of all data files is 100 MB.

For each data file, you can define a custom folder header to specify the working folder directory to which it will be uploaded. If undefined, the files are uploaded to the default folder.

post.description:
Starts a batch job (using a defined processing pipeline) and uploads custom data to the dedicated Azure Blob Storage.
 You can reference the data by using the request:// connector.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description:
Authenticates your request. You can use:
 * Bearer API key. Generate its value in Settings | Administration | API Keys and place it in the header after the Bearer keyword, e.g. Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu
 * Basic authentication. Create a base64-encoded string from a username (any populated string) and a password (API key) in this format: username:password. Place it in the header after the Basic keyword, e.g. Basic YWRtaW46dGVzdFBhc3N3b3Jk.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Gives a custom name to the data file.

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: Data file is saved to the specified folder in the working folder | input directory.

parameters.name: useDraftPipeline
parameters.description: If true, the job will be run using a draft version of the processing pipeline.

parameters.name: useDraftResources
parameters.description: If true, the job will be run using a draft version of the relevant resources (scripts, connectors).

parameters.name: variables
parameters.description: List of pipeline variables used for the job. Each variable should be a separate header with the name prefixed by "c-variable-", e.g. "c-variable-subject" with the value of "Invitation to Apply for a Credit Card" will create a variable "subject" with this value. The maximum number of these variables is 50 or as allowed by the maximum size of headers.

parameters.name: PipelineName
parameters.description: Unique name of the processing pipeline. If the pipeline is inside a folder, this parameter must contain the whole path, e.g. PipelineName:"Folder/NestedFolder/pipelineName".

parameters.name: PipelineName
parameters.description: Unique name of the processing pipeline. If the pipeline is inside a folder, this parameter must contain the whole path, e.g. PipelineName:"Folder/NestedFolder/pipelineName".

post.description: Stops the selected job, i.e. the batch will stop being processed or will be removed from the processing queue.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Batch processing. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description:
Stops batch jobs in bulk based on the date and time of their last update i.e. all jobs with values of the LastUpdate parameters set within the specified time range.
 Any jobs created after the request is called will not be stopped, regardless of the set time range.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Maintenance. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description: Creates a new change set.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Content management - Write. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description: Checks the health of the application, i.e. whether it is running or not.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: On-demand processing, Content management - View, Job management, Batch processing or Administration. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

200.description: Returns the health status of an application.

post.description: Retrieves logs of a Batch job saved in the specified time period. The maximum number of requests per second is 20 and up to 5 requests can run concurrently.

schema.description: Contains raw binary data which corresponds to requested object.

post.description:
Downloads raw statistics data about batch job processing. Limited to one request per second.
 The report can also be downloaded as a CSV file in the Generate GUI (Operator Dashboard).

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Job management. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

schema.description: Contains raw binary data which corresponds to requested object.

post.description:
Returns all job logs starting from a given timestamps up to a specified limit.
 Note that the request cannot be processed concurrently, i.e. you cannot send further requests until the current one returns a response.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Job management. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

200.description: Contains raw binary data which corresponds to requested object.

schema.description: Contains raw binary data which corresponds to requested object.

post.description: Retrieves logs of a On Demand job saved in the specified time period. The maximum number of requests per second is 20 and up to 5 requests can run concurrently.

schema.description: Contains raw binary data which corresponds to requested object.

post.description:
Returns production auditing data based on the specified cursor parameter.
 To use this API request, production auditing must be enabled in the Production Auditing section and there must be some logged data available.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Production auditing. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description: Retrieves logs of scenario jobs specified via the available parameters.

schema.description: Contains raw binary data which corresponds to requested object.

Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

Permission: Batch processing, Content management - Write. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description: Deletes the specified processing pipeline.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Content management - Write. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description:
Deletes the specified version of the processing pipeline.
 Note that you cannot delete the current production version or the last existing version of the pipeline.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Content management - Write. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description: Deletes the specified job working folder (including all its stored data).

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Batch processing, Content management - Write. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description: Increases the hit count of a specified processing pipeline by a specified amount. After a specific number of hits (set in GUI), the pipeline is triggered.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Secret password for authenticating your request. Generate its value in Settings | Administration | API Keys and place it in the header after the Bearer keyword, e.g. Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu

post.description: Lists all processing pipelines with their details.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Content management - View. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

post.description: Renames the specified processing pipeline.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Bearer token for authenticating your request. You need to generate an API key for a user role with relevant permissions in Settings | Aministration | API Keys and use it as a Bearer token. Permission: Content management - Write. Example: Bearer ox6933/jZ29ZXqS22V0vNk1zaM9l6sqRHD5W3LMb3tLu.

path.description:
The Path parameter points to a single object in the root (e.g. "Connectors/connectorName") or in the specified folder (e.g. "Connectors/folderA/connectorName"). 
 The first part of the path changes based on the resource's type: connectors - "Connectors/"; pipelines - "Pipelines/'; custom modules - "Custom Modules/"; ICM files - "icm://".
 The path can also point to all contents of a folder. For example, "Connectors/folderA/" adds all connectors located in the "folderA" folder.

withDependencies.description: A flag that adds all of the resource's dependencies to the change set package. For example, a pipeline can have a template file and a connector as its dependencies.

changeSetId.description: Unique identifier of the change set.

pipelineName.description: Unique name identifying the processing pipeline (including the complete path if the pipeline is in a folder). If a pipeline with this name does not exist at the specified path, a new pipeline with this name is created (including its parent folders, if required).

onErrorSteps.description:
List of processing pipeline steps that will be processed in case an error occurs.
 On execution of this parameter, a log containing errors/warnings is created in the following location: blob://.error.log.

workingFolderId.description:
Unique identifier of an existing job working folder.
 Note that assigning existing working folders is currently not supported for on-demand mode. This means that if you assign a working folder (you have created in the GUI) and then start the pipeline in on-demand mode, this setting will be ignored and a new on-demand working folder will be created instead (share://ondemand/JobID).

createWorkingFolder.description:
If true, a new job working folder will be created for the batch.
 Note that the request cannot have both the createWorkingFolder and workingFolderId parameters defined at the same time. If both are defined, the request will fail.

isDraft.description: If true, the processing pipeline will be in a draft state (false by default). If set as true for a pipeline that already has a draft, the existing draft will be overwritten.

hasTriggersActive.description: Specifies whether triggers can be used with this pipeline or not. If set to false, triggers are inactive, even if they are configured for the pipeline. Setting this option to off does not remove trigger configuration. This property is always active by default. If you need to disable triggers (e.g. for testing), set it to false.

versionComment.description: Specifies a comment for the production version of the pipeline.

requiredRoles.description: Roles that are used in the job and are required to publish the pipeline.

authorizedRoles.description: Only users with at least one of the following roles can execute the pipeline.

TriggersDto.description: List of pipeline triggers that automatically start a new job when defined conditions are met.

hotFolderPath.description: Path to a subfolder within the hot folder in the dedicated Azure Blob Storage. If left empty, the root share://hotfolder folder is used.

okFile.description: Name of the file that functions as the pipeline trigger. The file must share its name with the relevant data file, e.g. customersMetadata.csv.ok. If you want your pipeline to use various data files with different formats and names, you can use masking characters.

isEnabled.description: This parameter specifies whether the trigger is active.

HotFolderTriggerRequestDto.description: Configures the Hot Folder trigger. It triggers a processing pipeline when a data file and an OK file is uploaded to the hot folder within your dedicated Azure Blob Storage.

cronExpressions.description: List of cron expressions defining the times at which the pipeline will be triggered.

isEnabled.description: This parameter specifies whether the trigger is active.

TimeTriggerRequestDto.description: Configures the Time Trigger. You can schedule the processing pipeline to be triggered periodically at fixed times, dates, or intervals by using cron expressions.

expression.description: Custom cron expression, e.g. 0 0/5 * * * ? * will trigger the pipeline every 5 minutes.

hitsToRun.description: Number of hits that have to be made for the job to be triggered.

isEnabled.description: This parameter specifies whether the trigger is active.

HitTriggerRequestDto.description: Configures the Hit Trigger. Calling the increaseHitCount API service increases the hit count; the pipeline will be triggered when the set number of hits is reached.

failureNotificationEnabled.description:
If true, an additional notification is sent if the given step has failed. It is useful if you want to monitor the specific step. The notification delivery is configured in the Notifications section.
 Currently it is not supported for on-demand mode.

continueOnFailure.description: If true, the pipeline will continue to be processed even if the step has failed. If false, the job will fail or (if defined) the onErrorSteps will be processed.

template.description: Path to the template used to generate documents.

channel.description: Output channel defining the format and means of document delivery.

outputType.description: File type of the generated document. The value is mandatory for print steps.

generateType.description: Type of the Generate step. Set it based on the origin of the used template (Inspire Designer or Content Author). By default, it is InspireDesigner.

productionConfiguration.description: Path to the production configuration file used to generate the documents.

outputPath.description: Location where the output will be stored.

customAttachments.description: Specifies custom attachments from a Front Office ticket and attaches them to the email. For this feature to be functional, you must specify the ${system.attachments} system variable.

customParameters.description: Defines values that are to be passed to individual parameters within the ParamInput module.

correlationId.description: Correlation identifier used to mark batches so their status can easily be checked later. Use of variables is supported.

communicationIdStrategy.description:
Defines strategy used for applying correlation ID to the batch name field.
 OverrideWithCustomValue is the default value where the correlation ID has priority; None does not manipulate the communication ID (i.e. settings within the template are applied); Append combines the template's settings with the correlation ID; Override substitutes the template's settings with the correlation ID.

metadataPath.description: Saves a sheet name metadata file to the specified path (following the storage scheme). The file is in the JSON format and can be used to aid integration with external systems (e.g. DocuSign).

GenerateStepEnterpriseDto.description: Step configuration used to generate documents. The parameters mirror the options in the processing-pipeline editor.

attachmentName.description: Attachment will be renamed to the specified value.

path.description: Path to the static attachment file.

name.description: Name of the data input. It must match the name of the template's data input module. For example, DataInput for Content Author templates.

path.description: Path to the data input file.

name.description: Specifies the parameter within the ParamInput module to which the value will be passed. The value must have the following format: <ParameterName><ParamInputModuleName>, e.g. greetingsParamInput1.

value.description: Specifies the value that will be passed to the specified parameter.

configuration.description: Specifies the path to a configuration file containing the error recovery settings. It is a Warning Preferences File (WPR) that can be configured and retrieved from Inspire Designer.

errorIndex.description: Specifies the path where an error index file will be created. This file contains a list of indexes referencing the records that could not be processed.

layoutName.description:
Name of the template's Layout module the error recovery settings will be applied to.
 When using a Content Author template, do not define this parameter.This is because these templates always have only one Layout module.

ErrorRecoveryEnterpriseDto.description: Lists error recovery options. These manage how individual errors are treated and list them in an external file.

clientId.description: ID of the user within the DAS application.

documentName.description: Name of the document that will be displayed in the DAS application.

DigitalServicesSettingsEnterpriseDto.description: Specifies the required properties (clientId, documentName, and ApplicationId) for uploading digital content to the DAS application.

conditionValue.description: Condition that will be evaluated against all case parameters.

conditionOperator.description: The operator used in conditions to compare whether two values are the same or different.

matchMode.description: Specifies the way matching condition values are evaluated. First - only the first case matching the condition will be processed; All - all cases matching the condition will be processed in a sequence.

cases.description: Defines cases that will be executed if the defined conditions are met.

elseSteps.description: Configures steps that will be executed if no condition is met.

SwitchStepEnterpriseV6Dto.description: Step configuration that allows you to define conditional generation. There can be up to 5 levels of nested Switch parameters.

conditionValue.description: Condition that will be evaluated against the correlated case parameter. It overrides the default condition value.

conditionOperator.description: The operator used in conditions to compare whether two values are the same or different.

case.description: Defines a case statement. If it matches the conditionValue, the correlated steps will be executed.

steps.description: List of processing pipeline steps that will be processed if the case matches the conditionValue.

modulePath.description:
Path to the module, consisting of the root folder, any optional module folders, and the name of the module, i.e. "\<root folder\>/\<folder\>/\<name\>" or "\<root folder\>/\<name\>".
 Use the "Custom Modules" root folder for custom modules and "Public Modules" root folder for pre-prepared modules. For example: "Custom Modules/Data/Download Source File", "Custom Modules/Json to XML", "Public Modules/Utilities/Resource Copy".

approvedCapabilities.description: Specifies the capabilities that are approved to be used by the module.

outputParametersMapping.description: Maps the module's output parameters to variables.

parameterId.description: Identifier of the module parameter ("id" parameter defined in the "getDescription()" function).

value.description: Value of the module parameter. It can contain variables.

outputParameterId.description: Unique identifier of the module output parameter to be mapped.

variable.description: Code name of the variable including the "pipeline" prefix (the only currently supported variable type), e.g. ${pipeline.myVariable}.

customTimeoutEnabled.description: If true, enables custom timeout for the step.

StepEnterpriseTimeoutsDto.description: Sets timeouts for the processing of a step.

isRequired.description: If true, the variable must contain a value.

codeName.description: Code name of the variable. When using the variable, use this value prefixed by "pipeline", "global", or "system" (depending on its type), e.g. ${pipeline.myVariable}.

value.description: Value of the variable. It will be used when the pipeline is started.

options.description: List of all values accepted by the variable.

PipelineEnterpriseTimeoutsDto.description: Sets timeouts for the processing of a pipeline.

cronExpression.description: Defines a cron expression specifying the times at which the notification will be sent.

JobNotPerformedNotificationPublicApiRequ.description: Enables sending of notifications in case the job is not performed.

pipelineName.description: Unique name identifying the processing pipeline.

name.description: Name of the job working folder. It will be visible in GUI and will be a part of the folder's ID.

expiration.description:
Date and time the folder will expire and be deleted (date/time format according to the ISO 8601 standard).
 The behavior of the parameter changes based on the isJobDedicated settings, i.e. if isJobDedicated is true or undefined, expiration cannot be set to more than 90 days and leaving expiration undefined sets the expiration to 90 days; if isJobDedicated is false, expiration can be set to an arbitrary date and leaving expiration undefined causes the folder to never expire.

isJobDedicated.description: If true or undefined, the working folder will behave as an automatically created working folder while allowing you to prepare input data in advance.

workingFolderId.description: Unique identifier of the working folder.

from.description: Starting date and time of the CreatedDate interval for deleting the batch jobs. If unspecified, all past jobs are included.

to.description: Ending date and time of the CreatedDate interval for deleting the batch jobs. If unspecified, the current date and time of the call is used.

deleteWorkingFolder.description: If true, the assigned job working folders will be deleted as well, including all their stored data.

pipelineName.description: Unique name of the processing pipeline. If the pipeline is inside a folder, this parameter must contain the whole path, e.g. PipelineName:"Folder/NestedFolder/pipelineName".

batchJobId.description: Unique identifier of the batch job.

deleteWorkingFolder.description: If true, the assigned job working folders will be deleted as well, including all their stored data.

pipelineName.description: Unique name of the processing pipeline. If the pipeline is inside a folder, this parameter must contain the whole path, e.g. PipelineName:"Folder/NestedFolder/pipelineName".

workingFolderId.description: Unique identifier of the working folder that will be deleted along with its stored data.

pipelineName.description: Unique name of the processing pipeline. If the pipeline is inside a folder, this parameter must contain the whole path, e.g. PipelineName:"Folder/NestedFolder/pipelineName".

increaseAmount.description: Specifies the amount of the increase.

pipelineName.description: Unique name of the processing pipeline. If the pipeline is inside a folder, this parameter must contain the whole path, e.g. PipelineName:"Folder/NestedFolder/pipelineName".

newPipelineName.description: New unique name identifying the processing pipeline (including the complete path, if the pipeline is in a folder). Changing the pipeline's path moves the pipeline to the new location. If any folders specified in the path do not exist, they are created.

pipelineName.description: Unique name identifying the processing pipeline.

batchJobId.description: Unique identifier of the batch job.

hasPriority.description:
If true, the job will start as soon as possible, i.e. it will skip other jobs in the processing queue.
 Note that this property is obsolete. The Priority property should be used instead.

priority.description:
Specifies the job priority. Jobs with higher priority are run first. The
 value set here overwrites any priority set when designing the pipeline.

workingFolderId.description: Unique identifier of the job working folder.

batchJobId.description: Unique identifier of the batch job.

pipelineName.description: Name of the ad hoc pipeline (Ad Hoc Pipeline by default). If createWorkingFolder is true, the name will be reflected in the ID of the created job working folder.

onErrorSteps.description: List of processing pipeline steps that will be processed in case an error occurs. On execution of this parameter, a log containing errors/warnings is created in the following location: blob://.error.log.

workingFolderId.description: Unique identifier of an existing job working folder.

createWorkingFolder.description:
If true, a new job working folder will be created for the batch.
 Note that the request cannot have both the createWorkingFolder and workingFolderId parameters defined at the same time. If both are defined, the request will fail.

expiration.description: Date and time the batch expires (date/time format according to the ISO 8601 standard). Once expired, the job is deleted. If undefined, the job will expire in 90 days.

hasPriority.description: If true, the job will start as soon as possible, i.e. it will skip other jobs in the processing queue.

useDraftResources.description: If true, the job will be run using a draft version of the relevant resources (scripts, connectors).

failureNotificationEnabled.description:
If true, an additional notification is sent if the given step has failed. It is useful if you want to monitor the specific step. The notification delivery is configured in the Notifications section.
 Currently it is not supported for on-demand mode.

continueOnFailure.description: If true, the pipeline will continue to be processed even if the step has failed. If false, the job will fail or (if defined) the onErrorSteps will be processed.

template.description: Path to the template used to generate documents.

channel.description: Output channel defining the format and means of document delivery.

outputType.description: File type of the generated document.

generateType.description: Type of the Generate step. Set it based on the origin of the used template (Inspire Designer or Content Author). By default, it is InspireDesigner.

productionConfiguration.description: Path to the production configuration file used to generate the documents.

outputPath.description: Location where the output will be stored.

customAttachments.description: Specifies custom attachments from a Front Office ticket and attaches them to the email. For this feature to be functional, you must specify the ${system.attachments} system variable.

customParameters.description: Defines values that are to be passed to individual parameters within the ParamInput module.

correlationId.description: Correlation identifier used to mark batches so their status can easily be checked later. Use of variables is supported.

communicationIdStrategy.description:
Defines strategy used for applying correlation ID to the batch name field.
 OverrideWithCustomValue is the default value where the correlation ID has priority; None does not manipulate the communication ID (i.e. settings within the template are applied); Append combines the template's settings with the correlation ID; Override substitutes the template's settings with the correlation ID.

metadataPath.description: Saves a sheet name metadata file to the specified path (following the storage scheme). The file is in the JSON format and can be used to aid integration with external systems (e.g. DocuSign).

GenerateStepEnterpriseV3Dto.description: Step configuration used to generate documents. The parameters mirror the options in the processing-pipeline editor.

conditionValue.description: Condition that will be evaluated against all case parameters.

matchMode.description: Specifies the way matching condition values are evaluated. First - only the first case matching the condition will be processed; All - all cases matching the condition will be processed in a sequence.

cases.description: Defines cases that will be executed if the defined conditions are met.

elseSteps.description: Configures steps that will be executed if no condition is met.

SwitchStepEnterpriseV3Dto.description: Step configuration that allows you to define conditional generation. There can be up to 5 levels of nested Switch parameters.

conditionValue.description: Condition that will be evaluated against the correlated case parameter. It overrides the default condition value.

case.description: Defines a case statement. If it matches the conditionValue, the correlated steps will be executed.

steps.description: List of processing pipeline steps that will be processed if the case matches the conditionValue.

scriptPath.description:
Path to a script consisting of a schema, optional category and name, i.e. "\<schema\>://\<category\>/\<name\>" or "\<schema\>://\<name\>".
 Use the script:// schema for custom scripts and internalScript:// schema for pre-prepared scripting modules. For example: "script://Data/Download Source File", "script://Json to XML", "internalScript://Utilities/Resource Copy".

approvedCapabilities.description: Specifies which capabilities are approved to be used by script.

outputParametersMapping.description: Maps script output parameters to variables.

ScriptStepEnterpriseV3Dto.description: Step configuration used for custom scripts.

parameterId.description: Identifier of the script parameter ("id" parameter defined in the "getDescription()" function).

value.description: Value of the script parameter. It can contain variables.

type.description: Type of the variable ("pipeline" by default).

codeName.description: Code name of the variable. When using the variable, use this value prefixed by "pipeline", "global", or "system" (depending on its type), e.g. ${pipeline.myVariable}.

value.description: Value of the variable. It will be used when the pipeline is started.

options.description: List of all values accepted by the variable.

pipelineName.description: Name of the ad hoc pipeline (Ad Hoc Pipeline by default). If createWorkingFolder is true, the name will be reflected in the ID of the created job working folder.

onErrorSteps.description:
List of processing pipeline steps that will be processed in case an error occurs.
 On execution of this parameter, a log containing errors/warnings is created in the following location: blob://.error.log.

workingFolderId.description: Unique identifier of an existing job working folder.

createWorkingFolder.description:
If true, a new job working folder will be created for the batch.
 Note that the request cannot have both the createWorkingFolder and workingFolderId parameters defined at the same time. If both are defined, the request will fail.

expiration.description: Date and time the batch expires (date/time format according to the ISO 8601 standard). Once expired, the job is deleted. If undefined, the job will expire in 90 days.

useDraftResources.description: If true, the job will be run using a draft version of the relevant resources (scripts, connectors).

pipelineName.description: Unique name of the processing pipeline. If the pipeline is inside a folder, this parameter must contain the whole path, e.g. PipelineName:"Folder/NestedFolder/pipelineName".

workingFolderId.description: Unique identifier of an existing job working folder. If a different working folder is set in the pipeline, the folder specified here takes priority.

expiration.description: Date and time the batch expires (date/time format according to the ISO 8601 standard). Once expired, the job is deleted. If undefined, the job will expire in 90 days.

hasPriority.description:
If true, the job will start as soon as possible, i.e. it will skip other jobs in the processing queue.
 Note that this property is obsolete. The Priority property should be used instead.

priority.description:
Specifies the job priority. Jobs with higher priority are run first. The
 value set here overwrites any priority set when designing the pipeline.

variables.description:
List of processing pipeline variables.
 It can be used to override values of existing variables in the given processing pipeline. E.g. when a variable is used in the pipeline's output path, by defining a different value for the same codeName, you can easily change the output path as you start the pipeline without having to re-configure the pipeline itself.

useDraftPipeline.description: If true, the job will be run using a draft version of the processing pipeline.

useDraftResources.description: If true, the job will be run using a draft version of the relevant resources (scripts, connectors).

from.description: Starting date and time of the LastUpdate interval for stopping the batch jobs. If unspecified, all past jobs are included.

to.description: Ending date and time of the LastUpdate interval for stopping the batch jobs. If unspecified, the current date and time of the call is used.

batchJobId.description: Unique identifier of the batch job.

application.description: Specifies the application to be checked.

status.description: The health status of the application.

application.description: Specifies the application to be checked.

batchJobId.description: Unique identifier of the batch job.

steps.description: Steps of the batch job and their details.

onErrorSteps.description: On error steps of the batch job and their details.

progress.description: Approximate completeness of the batch job's processing. The value represents a percentage and can be between 0 and 100.

id.description: Unique identifier of the batch job.

state.description: Current state of the batch job.

createdDate.description: Date and time the batch job was created.

startedDate.description: Date and time the batch job was started.

startedProcessingDate.description: Date and time the batch job was started processing.

finishedDate.description: Date and time the batch job was finished.

expiration.description: Date and time the batch job expires.

lastUpdateDate.description: Date and time the batch job was last updated.

hasPriority.description: If true, the job started with a priority.

testingMode.description: If true, the job started in testing mode.

stoppedOnBreakpoint.description: If true, the job stopped at breakpoint.

id.description: Unique identifier of the job working folder.

name.description: Name of the job working folder.

lastUpdateDate.description: Date and time the job working folder has last been updated.

created.description: Date and time the job working folder was created.

expirationDate.description: Date and time the job working folder expires (and will be deleted).

expirationEnabled.description: If true, expiration is enabled and the folder will be deleted once expired.

BatchWorkingFolderEnterpriseDto.description: Details about the working folder used by the batch job.

accumulatedWrittenData.description: Amount of data that has been written to the working folder since its creation (it does not equal the current amount of stored data).

inputWrittenData.description:
Amount of data that has been written to an input folder within the working folder since its creation.
 The value is calculated only if the input folder contains an Input value in its name.

outputWrittenData.description:
Amount of data that has been written to an output folder within the working folder since its creation.
 The value is calculated only if the output folder contains an Output value in its name.

BatchJobDataSizeDto.description: Renders the amount of written data.

batchJobIds.description: Unique identifiers of the batch jobs.

batchJobId.description: Unique identifier of the batch job.

jobId.description: ID of the job for which to retrieve the logs. Alternatively, you can use CorrelationId.

correlationId.description: Custom correlation ID used to identify the job. If it was specified for the job, you can use it instead of JobId.

start.description: The start of the interval in which to search for the logs (in ISO format).

end.description: The end of the interval in which to search for the logs. The default value is 10 minutes; the maximum value is 7 days.

fromDate.description: Starting date from which raw statistics data will be included (date/time format according to the ISO 8601 standard).

toDate.description: Ending date from which raw statistics data will not be included (date/time format according to the ISO 8601 standard).

applicationFilter.description: Filters data by application, i.e. use Batch to retrieve statistics for Generate Batch jobs, or use OnDemand for Generate On Demand job statistics. Use All to retrieve all data regardless of the application (if not defined, data from all applications is returned as well).

fromDate.description: Starting date from which raw statistics data will be included (date/time format according to the ISO 8601 standard).

toDate.description: Ending date from which raw statistics data will not be included (date/time format according to the ISO 8601 standard).

applicationFilter.description: Filters data by application, i.e. use Batch to retrieve statistics for Generate Batch jobs, or use OnDemand for Generate On Demand job statistics. Use All to retrieve all data regardless of the application (if not defined, data from all applications is returned as well).

from.description:
Unix timestamp in nanoseconds from which job logs will be included.
 For subsequent requests, use the timestamp of the last returned line and add 1 nanoseconds (otherwise the log will contain a duplicate entry).
 The value can range between the present time up to one year in the past.

lineLimit.description: Limits the number of job logs that will be returned. The maximum and default value is 10000.

application.description: Filters data by application type. By default, job logs from all applications are returned.

from.description:
Unix timestamp in nanoseconds from which job logs will be included.
 For subsequent requests, use the timestamp of the last returned line and add 1 nanoseconds (otherwise the log will contain a duplicate entry).

lineLimit.description: Limits the number of job logs that will be returned. The maximum and default value is 10000.

application.description: Filters data by application type. By default, job logs from all applications are returned.

pipelines.description: List of processing pipelines with their details.

pipelineId.description: Unique numerical identifier of the processing pipeline.

pipelineName.description: Unique name of the processing pipeline.

draftState.description: Current state of the pipeline draft.

lastProductionVersion.description: Number of the current production version. If no such version exists, its value is null.

priority.description: Default job priority (configured in the pipeline).

updatedBy.description: User name of the user who last updated the pipeline.

triggerTypes.description: List of the triggers configured for the pipeline.

lastRun.description: The last time a job was run form this pipeline.

jobId.description: ID of the job for which to retrieve the logs. Alternatively, you can use CorrelationId.

correlationId.description: Custom correlation ID used to identify the job. If it was specified for the job, you can use it instead of JobId.

start.description: The start of the interval in which to search for the logs (in ISO format).

end.description: The end of the interval in which to search for the logs. The default value is 10 minutes; the maximum value is 7 days.

cursor.description:
For the initial API call, define the date and time from which you want to list the data. For subsequent API calls, specify a unique string from the previous API response.
 For a list of the supported date/time formats, see the Evolve REST API Reference Guide documentation.

maxCount.description: Maximum number of records that should be returned.

cursor.description: Unique string that must be used in subsequent calls. Each cursor value is only valid for 24 hours.

For the initial API call, define the date and time from which you want to list the data. For subsequent API calls, specify a unique string from the previous API response.
 For a list of the supported date/time formats, see the Evolve REST API Reference Guide documentation.

maxCount.description: Maximum number of records that should be returned.

jobId.description: ID of the scenario job for which to retrieve the logs.

skipBatchLogs.description: Specifies whether related batch job logs will be excluded from the results (false by default). If true, the results will include only scenario job logs.

start.description: The start of the interval in which to search for the logs (in ISO format).

end.description: The end of the interval in which to search for the logs. The default value is 1 hour; the maximum value is 90 days.
